reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup:** Narda Clone, Single coil  26g Kanthal @.7 ohms.  25W Power, Half wicked with Native Wicks 

**Testing:** SA Donut @ 3%. 70/30 VG/PG, steeped 7 days.

**Flavor Description:**  Slightly greasy fried dough with a light bready flavor, everything you would think you would want with a donut. It isn't quite as sweet as something like Zeppola but does have a bit of sweetness and has a bit of yeasty taste but not nearly as off putting as FA Joy. 

**Off-flavors:**  Right after a shake it was very yeasty and greasy tasting, almost had that play dough type taste to it but steeped out quite nicely.

**Throat Hit:**  Very minimal

**Uses & Pairings:**  This is a complete donut just waiting for your favorite fruit toppings or creams for a cream filled donut. I can see pairing this with zeppola for a bit more sweetness or maybe even flv maple bar for a maple donut. 

**Notes:**
This flavor changed quite a bit with a steep. When I tried it after a shake it was awful, very yeasty tasting similar to joy or cap glazed donut. After it steeped it turned into a well balanced complete donut flavor.


**[DIY_eJuice Flavor Reviews](https://www.reddit.com/r/DIY_eJuice/wiki/index/flavor_reviews)**

If you have different opinions on the flavor or any ideas on how to use it please post them in the comments. Lets start a discussion!
reviewsJson.author: mlNikon
reviewsJson.title: Donut
